The Learning Lens: VII
Visible
The men and women who face
the etv cameras are variously re¬
ferred to as “the talent,” “on-
camera professors/’ “lecturers,”
“teleteachers,” “moderators,”
“narrators,” or “studio teachers.”
The value of etv hinges on their
knowledge, skill, and enthusiasm,
despite the elaborate technology,
painstaking administrative plan¬
ning, and ingenious visual aids.
Although non-teachers from
many fields occasionally supple¬
ment and enrich etv, the screen is
occupied most of the time by men
and women from the staffs of
schools, colleges, and universities,
whether the program is for aca¬
demic credit or for general interest.
This is not to say that teachers
and professors treat etv simply as
a classroom or lecture hall with stu¬
dents at a distance. The teacher on
